gov.usgs.anss.edgethread

Class EdgeThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ADSLServer, CD11ConnectionServer, CD11LinkServer, CD11OIReader, CD11RingProcessor, CD11SenderClient, DataLinkServer, DataLinkSocket, DatasockClient, EdgeBlockClient, EdgeBlockServer, EdgeBlockSocket, EdgeChannelServer, EdgemomConfigThread, EdgeThreadMonitor, EdgeThreadTemplate, EWImportServer, FakeThread, GetFileIIServer, GetFileIISocket, GSNManager, HoldingSender, Hydra, IndexChecker, IndexFileServer, ISILink, K2Processor, LHDerivedToQueryMom, LISSClient, Logger, MiniSeedServer, MiniSeedSocket, MulticastDataProcessor, NetservClient, NoDBConfig, OutputInfrastructure, Q330Manager, Q330OneSecServer, Q330OneSecSocket, Q680Manager, Q680Server, RawInputServer, RawInputSocket, RawInputUdpSocket, ReftekClient, ReftekManager, Replicator, RingFileToChannelInfrastructure, RRPClient, RRPServer, RRPToEdge, ScreamClient, SeedLinkClient, SeedLinkConfigBuilder, Subprocess, TestRawToMiniSeed4, TraceBufListener

    public abstract class EdgeThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    This sets up the required /commonn stuff for a EdgeMom controlled Thread class. It provides the common stuff like output, annotation, and control needed by EdgeMom. Any subclass should set logname if it wants indiviual logging files for this thread, if logfile is null, then its logging will be merged with the EdgeMom log preceded the tag. Each thread should then use prt() or prta() to record any output.

    1) Each Subclass of this must have a constructor(String line, String tg) where line is parsed for command line arguments, and then call super(line,tg) 1st thing. This sets up the command elements for the EdgeThread (sets the tag, opens log files after > or >>). Don't forget to strip the > or >> section if your code will gag on it.

    2) Each subclass should set running=true when its run method is started and set it false if it exits.

    3) Each subclass should terminate its main thread if terminate is found true, it should set terminate false at completion of the thread.

    4) Create all abstract methods specified below : getConsoleOutput() (any output not written via the prt() or prta() function. Normally this is stdout or stderr for real subprocesses created using Subprocess class. This output will be sent to the appropriate log (thread log or edgemom log) depending on the logname setting. By doConsoleLog().

    terminate() this will start a termination of the thread. At a minimum the terminate variable in the base class should be set true, and then set false when the thread exits. This gives a change to the user to cause blocked threads to terminate quickly and gracefully especially by closing I/O channels, calling "interrupt()" to get out of sleeps and waits, etc. Care should be taken that a thread that has this called will quit (preferably soon, but certainly surely!).

    getStatusString() return something to display on the status lines by process

    5) after calling super() the thread can add stuff to its "tag". InitThread() will make a tag like "uniqueTag[Thread-nn]" typically add a "type" on as a two character string +":". So for LISS client tag += "LC:"

    6) It is important that the thread catch RuntimeException and cause the thread to exit as if its "terminate" flag was set. The EdgeMom thread should then be able to restart the thread and processing will continue *

      • EdgeThread

        public EdgeThread(java.lang.String line,
          java.lang.String tg)
        process the initialization for the EdgeThread. Set the tag and open the log file if the command line has ">" or ">>" on it.
        Parameters:
        line - The command line parameters (parse for > or >> to set log name)
        tg - The unique tag which will appear on any lines header for EdgeMom.prt()

        public void sleep(int ms)
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        override the sleep method so that it terminates if the terminate variable is set. This means we cannot sleep throught a shutdown!
        Parameters:
        ms - Number of millis to sleep
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If its thrown by Thread.sleep()

      • prt

        public void prt(java.lang.StringBuffer s)
        print the string on 1) My local output file if defined, 2) The EdgeMom log with tag if not. Synchronized to avoid interspersed output from multiple threads.
        Parameters:
        s - The string buffer to print

      • prta

        public void prta(java.lang.StringBuffer s)
        print the string on 1) My local output file if defined, 2) The EdgeMom log with tag if not. Synchronized to avoid interspersed output from multiple threads.
        Parameters:
        s - The string buffer to print
